column4: how could i install the kernel sources ? i could try that first

on the installation
let me paste it online
are you trying to install nvidia driver on 9.04 amd64?
yeap. my privious nvidia installation was from the nvidia binary, not from a repo package
why don't you use nvidia binary? it works ok for me.
i am using the nvidia binaries , thats what i said, i dont use the deb package
did you use "NVIDIA*** --uninstall"?
no
you should have used it. it removes them automatically. i did it several times. always works :)
have you managed to uninstall it?
did you understand what i said just now? let me rephrase it. you have to run nvidia binary driver installer with --uninstall switch. got it?
yeap
try it :) let me know if it's not working
does it work?
may i know what error?
why don't you use the latest 180.* or 185.*?

give me the full file name of your nvidia driver installer...
as far as i know linux-source shouldn't be needed, but it is worth trying since you are using old driver....
no problem. you can always uninstall it safely

if you are using amd64 then yes...
